intro: Rinorea oubanguiensis, commonly known as the Congo beauty or African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rinorea oubanguiensis is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks.
